page.title: 05THE ACLE BY-PASS
page.content: LIKELY THAT THE SOUTHERN ROUTE HAS BEEN CHOSEN BECAUSE IT IS THE SHORTER (AND HENCE CHEAPER) OF THE TWO OPTIONS.THERE IS,HOWEVER,EVERY CHANCE THAT,EVEN AFTER THE NEW ROAD IS BUILT, ITS SITING WILL CAUSE CONTROVERSY FOR YEARS TO COME.VILLAGERS POINT OUT THAT THE PROPOSED DEVELOPMENT OF A DEEP_WATER HARBOUR AT YARMOUTH WILL NECESSITATE FURTHER IMPROVEMENTS TO THE AREA'S ROADS AND ARE CONCERNED THAT THE RELIEF ROAD WILL ULTIMATELY EVOLVE INTO A MAJOR TRUNK ROAD OR EVEN A MOTORWAY. UNCERTAINTY ABOUT THE SITING OF THE BY-PASS AND ITS MAJOR LINK TO THE CAISTER ROAD HAS LED TO A CERTAIN AMOUNT OF "PANIC SELLING" OF LOCAL PROPERTIES,WITH THE INEVITABLE DECLINE IN HOUSE PRICES.
